result.execSummary:
The defendant Evan M. Gucwa was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent to include Anger Management.  DE has 3 days jail credit if probation revoked.   ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS

If probation/extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Defendant may apply for expungment if law abiding & fine paid in full within 18 mos.. Upon successful completion of probation, record may be expunged, 973.015.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Evan M. Gucwa in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.

Count 1:  Dismissed but read in

Counts 2 & 3:
18 months Probation
DNA surcharge/sample
Undergo any counseling per agent to include Anger Management
3 days jail credit if probation revoked
$543.00 x 2 Fine/Costs fees (PAID THRU CLERK OF COURTS) 
Defendant may apply for expungment if law abiding & fine paid in full within 18 mos.. Upon successful completion of probation, record may be expunged, 973.015.
Paperwork handed in court.  Review scheduled for May 20, 2016.  Review scheduled for July 20, 2017.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 20, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Puck Tsai in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Tsai states he talked to DE and matter is resolved.  Not sure why he's not here.  State requests new plea date.  Court so orders and JT is canceled.  Bond continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 20, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
Defendant Evan M. Gucwa in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea, set for trial br. 1.  Bond continues.
Defendant Evan M. Gucwa in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Dennis Joseph Ryan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds probable cause, bind over for Br 1.

Defendant Evan M. Gucwa in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Need to work through some minor details.  Cannot proceed to plea/sentencing quite yet.  Requests preliminary hearing.  Bond continues.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Evan M. Gucwa in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Michael X. Albrecht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is resolved, however request plea/sentencing next week.  Bond continues.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference at 10-23-2015 09:00 am.
Return date at 11-04-2015 01:00 pm.

Defendant Evan M. Gucwa appeared by video means with Attorney Tsai. Prosecuting Atty Sue Mueller appeared for State of Wisconsin.   Defendant does qualify.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Time limits waived.  $1000.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol unless provides a valid Rx.  No contact with J.L. or her residence.  May return to premises one time, upon notice to pick up personal property and with law enforcement.  Shall not possess any firearms, bows, arrows or hunting knives.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Return date scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
